ContentClassification.TableReference: Dr. William Farr, “Twentieth Annual Report of the Registrar General of Births, Deaths and Marriages in England - Appendix”, H. Claves and Sons for Her Majesty’s Stationer’s Office (London, 1853) Accessed: April, 2014 from http://histpop.org/ohpr/servlet/Show?page=Home.
ContentClassification.TableDescription: English Life Tables (ELT) Number 2 (1838-44) - Female. Minimum Age: 0 Maximum Age: 98
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: Same population data from 1941 Census for England and Wales (i.e. not for all of the United Kingdom) that utilized in construction of English Life Table No. 1 (See SOA Table Identities 2755-2756). Deaths taken from the period 1938-44 published in the Ninth Registrar-Generals Report. Methodology: Corresponding tables for males were produced in the Appendix to the Twelfth Annual Report (See SOA Table Identity 2759). It was not till the Twentieth Annual Report that values constructed along the same lines was developed for the data of females. NOTE: Initial English Life Tables were printed with just lx values. Over time, the tables were expanded to include qx values that then became the predominant format for the tables of this database. To aid in tracking the data available, qx versions have been created for this and other older tables. (Counterpart qx tables for ELT No 2 have SOA Table Identities 2761-2762). Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 04/2014
